    ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlappedByItem     = 1 << 8,   // IsItemHovered() only: Return true even if the item uses AllowOverlap mode and is overlapped by another hoverable item.
1376
    ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlappedByWindow   = 1 << 9,   // IsItemHovered() only: Return true even if the position is obstructed or overlapped by another window.
1377
    ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenDisabled             = 1 << 10,  // IsItemHovered() only: Return true even if the item is disabled
1378
    ImGuiHoveredFlags_NoNavOverride                 = 1 << 11,  // IsItemHovered() only: Disable using gamepad/keyboard navigation state when active, always query mouse
1379
    ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlapped           = ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlappedByItem | ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlappedByWindow,
1380
    ImGuiHoveredFlags_RectOnly                      = ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup | ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem | ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlapped,
1381
    ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootAndChildWindows           = ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow | ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows,
1382
1383
    // Tooltips mode
1384
    // - typically used in IsItemHovered() + SetTooltip() sequence.
1385
    // - this is a shortcut to pull flags from 'style.HoverFlagsForTooltipMouse' or 'style.HoverFlagsForTooltipNav' where you can reconfigure desired behavior.
1386
    //   e.g. 'TooltipHoveredFlagsForMouse' defaults to 'ImGuiHoveredFlags_Stationary | ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayShort'.
1387
    // - for frequently actioned or hovered items providing a tooltip, you want may to use ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip (stationary + delay) so the tooltip doesn't show too often.
1388
    // - for items which main purpose is to be hovered, or items with low affordance, or in less consistent apps, prefer no delay or shorter delay.
1389
    ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip                    = 1 << 12,  // Shortcut for standard flags when using IsItemHovered() + SetTooltip() sequence.
1390
1391
    // (Advanced) Mouse Hovering delays.
1392
    // - generally you can use ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip to use application-standardized flags.
1393
    // - use those if you need specific overrides.
1394
    ImGuiHoveredFlags_Stationary                    = 1 << 13,  // Require mouse to be stationary for style.HoverStationaryDelay (~0.15 sec) _at least one time_. After this, can move on same item/window. Using the stationary test tends to reduces the need for a long delay.
1395
    ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayNone                     = 1 << 14,  // IsItemHovered() only: Return true immediately (default). As this is the default you generally ignore this.
1396
    ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayShort                    = 1 << 15,  // IsItemHovered() only: Return true after style.HoverDelayShort elapsed (~0.15 sec) (shared between items) + requires mouse to be stationary for style.HoverStationaryDelay (once per item).
1397
    ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayNormal                   = 1 << 16,  // IsItemHovered() only: Return true after style.HoverDelayNormal elapsed (~0.40 sec) (shared between items) + requires mouse to be stationary for style.HoverStationaryDelay (once per item).
1398
    ImGuiHoveredFlags_NoSharedDelay                 = 1 << 17,  // IsItemHovered() only: Disable shared delay system where moving from one item to the next keeps the previous timer for a short time (standard for tooltips with long delays)
1399
};
1400
1401
// Flags for ImGui::DockSpace(), shared/inherited by child nodes.
1402
// (Some flags can be applied to individual nodes directly)
1403
// FIXME-DOCK: Also see ImGuiDockNodeFlagsPrivate_ which may involve using the WIP and internal DockBuilder api.
1404
enum ImGuiDockNodeFlags_
1405
{
1406
    ImGuiDockNodeFlags_None                         = 0,
1407
    ImGuiDockNodeFlags_KeepAliveOnly                = 1 << 0,   //       // Don't display the dockspace node but keep it alive. Windows docked into this dockspace node won't be undocked.
1408
    //ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoCentralNode              = 1 << 1,   //       // Disable Central Node (the node which can stay empty)
1409
    ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingOverCentralNode     = 1 << 2,   //       // Disable docking over the Central Node, which will be always kept empty.
1410
    ImGuiDockNodeFlags_PassthruCentralNode          = 1 << 3,   //       // Enable passthru dockspace: 1) DockSpace() will render a ImGuiCol_WindowBg background covering everything excepted the Central Node when empty. Meaning the host window should probably use SetNextWindowBgAlpha(0.0f) prior to Begin() when using this. 2) When Central Node is empty: let inputs pass-through + won't display a DockingEmptyBg background. See demo for details.
1411
    ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingSplit               = 1 << 4,   //       // Disable other windows/nodes from splitting this node.
1412
    ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoResize                     = 1 << 5,   // Saved // Disable resizing node using the splitter/separators. Useful with programmatically setup dockspaces.
1413
    ImGuiDockNodeFlags_AutoHideTabBar               = 1 << 6,   //       // Tab bar will automatically hide when there is a single window in the dock node.
1414
    ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoUndocking                  = 1 << 7,   //       // Disable undocking this node.
1415
1416
#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
1417
    ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoSplit                      = ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingSplit, // Renamed in 1.90
1418
    ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingInCentralNode       = ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingOverCentralNode, // Renamed in 1.90
1419
#endif
1420
};
1421
1422
// Flags for ImGui::BeginDragDropSource(), ImGui::AcceptDragDropPayload()
1423
enum ImGuiDragDropFlags_
1424
{
1425
    ImGuiDragDropFlags_None                         = 0,
1426
    // BeginDragDropSource() flags
1427
    ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip       = 1 << 0,   // Disable preview tooltip. By default, a successful call to BeginDragDropSource opens a tooltip so you can display a preview or description of the source contents. This flag disables this behavior.
1428
    ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoDisableHover         = 1 << 1,   // By default, when dragging we clear data so that IsItemHovered() will return false, to avoid subsequent user code submitting tooltips. This flag disables this behavior so you can still call IsItemHovered() on the source item.
1429
    ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoHoldToOpenOthers     = 1 << 2,   // Disable the behavior that allows to open tree nodes and collapsing header by holding over them while dragging a source item.
1430
    ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAllowNullID            = 1 << 3,   // Allow items such as Text(), Image() that have no unique identifier to be used as drag source, by manufacturing a temporary identifier based on their window-relative position. This is extremely unusual within the dear imgui ecosystem and so we made it explicit.
1431
    ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceExtern                 = 1 << 4,   // External source (from outside of dear imgui), won't attempt to read current item/window info. Will always return true. Only one Extern source can be active simultaneously.
1432
    ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAutoExpirePayload      = 1 << 5,   // Automatically expire the payload if the source cease to be submitted (otherwise payloads are persisting while being dragged)
1433
    // AcceptDragDropPayload() flags
1434
    ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery         = 1 << 10,  // AcceptDragDropPayload() will returns true even before the mouse button is released. You can then call IsDelivery() to test if the payload needs to be delivered.
1435
    ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect      = 1 << 11,  // Do not draw the default highlight rectangle when hovering over target.
1436
    ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoPreviewTooltip       = 1 << 12,  // Request hiding the BeginDragDropSource tooltip from the BeginDragDropTarget site.
1437
    ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptPeekOnly               = ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery | ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect, // For peeking ahead and inspecting the payload before delivery.
1438
};
1439
1440
// Standard Drag and Drop payload types. You can define you own payload types using short strings. Types starting with '_' are defined by Dear ImGui.
1441
0
#define IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_3F     "_COL3F"    // float[3]: Standard type for colors, without alpha. User code may use this type.
1442
0
#define IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_4F     "_COL4F"    // float[4]: Standard type for colors. User code may use this type.
1443
1444
// A primary data type
1445
enum ImGuiDataType_
1446
{
1447
    ImGuiDataType_S8,       // signed char / char (with sensible compilers)
1448
    ImGuiDataType_U8,       // unsigned char
1449
    ImGuiDataType_S16,      // short
1450
    ImGuiDataType_U16,      // unsigned short
1451
    ImGuiDataType_S32,      // int
1452
    ImGuiDataType_U32,      // unsigned int
1453
    ImGuiDataType_S64,      // long long / __int64
1454
    ImGuiDataType_U64,      // unsigned long long / unsigned __int64
1455
    ImGuiDataType_Float,    // float
1456
    ImGuiDataType_Double,   // double
1457
    ImGuiDataType_COUNT
1458
};
1459
1460
// A cardinal direction
1461
enum ImGuiDir_
1462
{
1463
    ImGuiDir_None    = -1,
1464
    ImGuiDir_Left    = 0,
1465
    ImGuiDir_Right   = 1,
1466
    ImGuiDir_Up      = 2,
1467
    ImGuiDir_Down    = 3,
1468
    ImGuiDir_COUNT
1469
};
1470
1471
// A sorting direction
1472
enum ImGuiSortDirection_
1473
{
1474
    ImGuiSortDirection_None         = 0,
1475
    ImGuiSortDirection_Ascending    = 1,    // Ascending = 0->9, A->Z etc.
1476
    ImGuiSortDirection_Descending   = 2     // Descending = 9->0, Z->A etc.
1477
};
1478
1479
// A key identifier (ImGuiKey_XXX or ImGuiMod_XXX value): can represent Keyboard, Mouse and Gamepad values.
1480
// All our named keys are >= 512. Keys value 0 to 511 are left unused as legacy native/opaque key values (< 1.87).
1481
// Since >= 1.89 we increased typing (went from int to enum), some legacy code may need a cast to ImGuiKey.
1482
// Read details about the 1.87 and 1.89 transition : https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues/4921
1483
// Note that "Keys" related to physical keys and are not the same concept as input "Characters", the later are submitted via io.AddInputCharacter().
1484
enum ImGuiKey : int
1485
{
1486
    // Keyboard
1487
    ImGuiKey_None = 0,
1488
    ImGuiKey_Tab = 512,             // == ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN
1489
    ImGuiKey_LeftArrow,
1490
    ImGuiKey_RightArrow,
1491
    ImGuiKey_UpArrow,
1492
    ImGuiKey_DownArrow,
1493
    ImGuiKey_PageUp,
1494
    ImGuiKey_PageDown,
1495
    ImGuiKey_Home,
1496
    ImGuiKey_End,
1497
    ImGuiKey_Insert,
1498
    ImGuiKey_Delete,
1499
    ImGuiKey_Backspace,
1500
    ImGuiKey_Space,
1501
    ImGuiKey_Enter,
1502
    ImGuiKey_Escape,
1503
    ImGuiKey_LeftCtrl, ImGuiKey_LeftShift, ImGuiKey_LeftAlt, ImGuiKey_LeftSuper,
1504
    ImGuiKey_RightCtrl, ImGuiKey_RightShift, ImGuiKey_RightAlt, ImGuiKey_RightSuper,
1505
    ImGuiKey_Menu,
1506
    ImGuiKey_0, ImGuiKey_1, ImGuiKey_2, ImGuiKey_3, ImGuiKey_4, ImGuiKey_5, ImGuiKey_6, ImGuiKey_7, ImGuiKey_8, ImGuiKey_9,
1507
    ImGuiKey_A, ImGuiKey_B, ImGuiKey_C, ImGuiKey_D, ImGuiKey_E, ImGuiKey_F, ImGuiKey_G, ImGuiKey_H, ImGuiKey_I, ImGuiKey_J,
1508
    ImGuiKey_K, ImGuiKey_L, ImGuiKey_M, ImGuiKey_N, ImGuiKey_O, ImGuiKey_P, ImGuiKey_Q, ImGuiKey_R, ImGuiKey_S, ImGuiKey_T,
1509
    ImGuiKey_U, ImGuiKey_V, ImGuiKey_W, ImGuiKey_X, ImGuiKey_Y, ImGuiKey_Z,
1510
    ImGuiKey_F1, ImGuiKey_F2, ImGuiKey_F3, ImGuiKey_F4, ImGuiKey_F5, ImGuiKey_F6,
1511
    ImGuiKey_F7, ImGuiKey_F8, ImGuiKey_F9, ImGuiKey_F10, ImGuiKey_F11, ImGuiKey_F12,
1512
    ImGuiKey_F13, ImGuiKey_F14, ImGuiKey_F15, ImGuiKey_F16, ImGuiKey_F17, ImGuiKey_F18,
1513
    ImGuiKey_F19, ImGuiKey_F20, ImGuiKey_F21, ImGuiKey_F22, ImGuiKey_F23, ImGuiKey_F24,
1514
    ImGuiKey_Apostrophe,        // '
1515
    ImGuiKey_Comma,             // ,
1516
    ImGuiKey_Minus,             // -
1517
    ImGuiKey_Period,            // .
1518
    ImGuiKey_Slash,             // /
1519
    ImGuiKey_Semicolon,         // ;
1520
    ImGuiKey_Equal,             // =
1521
    ImGuiKey_LeftBracket,       // [
1522
    ImGuiKey_Backslash,         // \ (this text inhibit multiline comment caused by backslash)
1523
    ImGuiKey_RightBracket,      // ]
1524
    ImGuiKey_GraveAccent,       // `
1525
    ImGuiKey_CapsLock,
1526
    ImGuiKey_ScrollLock,
1527
    ImGuiKey_NumLock,
1528
    ImGuiKey_PrintScreen,
1529
    ImGuiKey_Pause,
1530
    ImGuiKey_Keypad0, ImGuiKey_Keypad1, ImGuiKey_Keypad2, ImGuiKey_Keypad3, ImGuiKey_Keypad4,
1531
    ImGuiKey_Keypad5, ImGuiKey_Keypad6, ImGuiKey_Keypad7, ImGuiKey_Keypad8, ImGuiKey_Keypad9,
1532
    ImGuiKey_KeypadDecimal,
1533
    ImGuiKey_KeypadDivide,
1534
    ImGuiKey_KeypadMultiply,
1535
    ImGuiKey_KeypadSubtract,
1536
    ImGuiKey_KeypadAdd,
1537
    ImGuiKey_KeypadEnter,
1538
    ImGuiKey_KeypadEqual,
1539
    ImGuiKey_AppBack,               // Available on some keyboard/mouses. Often referred as "Browser Back"
1540
    ImGuiKey_AppForward,
1541
1542
    // Gamepad (some of those are analog values, 0.0f to 1.0f)                          // NAVIGATION ACTION
1543
    // (download controller mapping PNG/PSD at http://dearimgui.com/controls_sheets)
1544
    ImGuiKey_GamepadStart,          // Menu (Xbox)      + (Switch)   Start/Options (PS)
1545
    ImGuiKey_GamepadBack,           // View (Xbox)      - (Switch)   Share (PS)
1546
    ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceLeft,       // X (Xbox)         Y (Switch)   Square (PS)        // Tap: Toggle Menu. Hold: Windowing mode (Focus/Move/Resize windows)
1547
    ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceRight,      // B (Xbox)         A (Switch)   Circle (PS)        // Cancel / Close / Exit
1548
    ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceUp,         // Y (Xbox)         X (Switch)   Triangle (PS)      // Text Input / On-screen Keyboard
1549
    ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceDown,       // A (Xbox)         B (Switch)   Cross (PS)         // Activate / Open / Toggle / Tweak
1550
    ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadLeft,       // D-pad Left                                       // Move / Tweak / Resize Window (in Windowing mode)
1551
    ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadRight,      // D-pad Right                                      // Move / Tweak / Resize Window (in Windowing mode)
1552
    ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadUp,         // D-pad Up                                         // Move / Tweak / Resize Window (in Windowing mode)
1553
    ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadDown,       // D-pad Down                                       // Move / Tweak / Resize Window (in Windowing mode)
1554
    ImGuiKey_GamepadL1,             // L Bumper (Xbox)  L (Switch)   L1 (PS)            // Tweak Slower / Focus Previous (in Windowing mode)
1555
    ImGuiKey_GamepadR1,             // R Bumper (Xbox)  R (Switch)   R1 (PS)            // Tweak Faster / Focus Next (in Windowing mode)
1556
    ImGuiKey_GamepadL2,             // L Trig. (Xbox)   ZL (Switch)  L2 (PS) [Analog]
1557
    ImGuiKey_GamepadR2,             // R Trig. (Xbox)   ZR (Switch)  R2 (PS) [Analog]
1558
    ImGuiKey_GamepadL3,             // L Stick (Xbox)   L3 (Switch)  L3 (PS)
1559
    ImGuiKey_GamepadR3,             // R Stick (Xbox)   R3 (Switch)  R3 (PS)
1560
    ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickLeft,     // [Analog]                                         // Move Window (in Windowing mode)
1561
    ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickRight,    // [Analog]                                         // Move Window (in Windowing mode)
1562
    ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickUp,       // [Analog]                                         // Move Window (in Windowing mode)
1563
    ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickDown,     // [Analog]                                         // Move Window (in Windowing mode)
1564
    ImGuiKey_GamepadRStickLeft,     // [Analog]
1565
    ImGuiKey_GamepadRStickRight,    // [Analog]
1566
    ImGuiKey_GamepadRStickUp,       // [Analog]
1567
    ImGuiKey_GamepadRStickDown,     // [Analog]
1568
1569
    // Aliases: Mouse Buttons (auto-submitted from AddMouseButtonEvent() calls)
1570
    // - This is mirroring the data also written to io.MouseDown[], io.MouseWheel, in a format allowing them to be accessed via standard key API.
1571
    ImGuiKey_MouseLeft, ImGuiKey_MouseRight, ImGuiKey_MouseMiddle, ImGuiKey_MouseX1, ImGuiKey_MouseX2, ImGuiKey_MouseWheelX, ImGuiKey_MouseWheelY,
1572
1573
    // [Internal] Reserved for mod storage
1574
    ImGuiKey_ReservedForModCtrl, ImGuiKey_ReservedForModShift, ImGuiKey_ReservedForModAlt, ImGuiKey_ReservedForModSuper,
1575
    ImGuiKey_COUNT,
1576
1577
    // Keyboard Modifiers (explicitly submitted by backend via AddKeyEvent() calls)
1578
    // - This is mirroring the data also written to io.KeyCtrl, io.KeyShift, io.KeyAlt, io.KeySuper, in a format allowing
1579
    //   them to be accessed via standard key API, allowing calls such as IsKeyPressed(), IsKeyReleased(), querying duration etc.
1580
    // - Code polling every key (e.g. an interface to detect a key press for input mapping) might want to ignore those
1581
    //   and prefer using the real keys (e.g. ImGuiKey_LeftCtrl, ImGuiKey_RightCtrl instead of ImGuiMod_Ctrl).
1582
    // - In theory the value of keyboard modifiers should be roughly equivalent to a logical or of the equivalent left/right keys.
1583
    //   In practice: it's complicated; mods are often provided from different sources. Keyboard layout, IME, sticky keys and
1584
    //   backends tend to interfere and break that equivalence. The safer decision is to relay that ambiguity down to the end-user...
1585
    ImGuiMod_None                   = 0,
1586
    ImGuiMod_Ctrl                   = 1 << 12, // Ctrl
1587
    ImGuiMod_Shift                  = 1 << 13, // Shift
1588
    ImGuiMod_Alt                    = 1 << 14, // Option/Menu
1589
    ImGuiMod_Super                  = 1 << 15, // Cmd/Super/Windows
1590
    ImGuiMod_Shortcut               = 1 << 11, // Alias for Ctrl (non-macOS) _or_ Super (macOS).
1591
    ImGuiMod_Mask_                  = 0xF800,  // 5-bits
1592
1593
    // [Internal] Prior to 1.87 we required user to fill io.KeysDown[512] using their own native index + the io.KeyMap[] array.
1594
    // We are ditching this method but keeping a legacy path for user code doing e.g. IsKeyPressed(MY_NATIVE_KEY_CODE)
1595
    // If you need to iterate all keys (for e.g. an input mapper) you may use ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN..ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END.
1596
    ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN         = 512,
1597
    ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END           = ImGuiKey_COUNT,
1598
    ImGuiKey_NamedKey_COUNT         = ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END - ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN,
1599
#ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO
1600
    ImGuiKey_KeysData_SIZE          = ImGuiKey_NamedKey_COUNT,  // Size of KeysData[]: only hold named keys
1601
    ImGuiKey_KeysData_OFFSET        = ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN,  // Accesses to io.KeysData[] must use (key - ImGuiKey_KeysData_OFFSET) index.
1602
#else
1603
    ImGuiKey_KeysData_SIZE          = ImGuiKey_COUNT,           // Size of KeysData[]: hold legacy 0..512 keycodes + named keys
1604
    ImGuiKey_KeysData_OFFSET        = 0,                        // Accesses to io.KeysData[] must use (key - ImGuiKey_KeysData_OFFSET) index.
1605
#endif
1606
1607
#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
1608
    ImGuiKey_ModCtrl = ImGuiMod_Ctrl, ImGuiKey_ModShift = ImGuiMod_Shift, ImGuiKey_ModAlt = ImGuiMod_Alt, ImGuiKey_ModSuper = ImGuiMod_Super, // Renamed in 1.89
1609
    ImGuiKey_KeyPadEnter = ImGuiKey_KeypadEnter,    // Renamed in 1.87
1610
#endif
1611
};
1612
1613
#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO
1614
// OBSOLETED in 1.88 (from July 2022): ImGuiNavInput and io.NavInputs[].
1615
// Official backends between 1.60 and 1.86: will keep working and feed gamepad inputs as long as IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO is not set.
1616
// Custom backends: feed gamepad inputs via io.AddKeyEvent() and ImGuiKey_GamepadXXX enums.
1617
enum ImGuiNavInput
1618
{
1619
    ImGuiNavInput_Activate, ImGuiNavInput_Cancel, ImGuiNavInput_Input, ImGuiNavInput_Menu, ImGuiNavInput_DpadLeft, ImGuiNavInput_DpadRight, ImGuiNavInput_DpadUp, ImGuiNavInput_DpadDown,
1620
    ImGuiNavInput_LStickLeft, ImGuiNavInput_LStickRight, ImGuiNavInput_LStickUp, ImGuiNavInput_LStickDown, ImGuiNavInput_FocusPrev, ImGuiNavInput_FocusNext, ImGuiNavInput_TweakSlow, ImGuiNavInput_TweakFast,
1621
    ImGuiNavInput_COUNT,
1622
};
1623
#endif
1624
1625
// Configuration flags stored in io.ConfigFlags. Set by user/application.
1626
enum ImGuiConfigFlags_
1627
{
1628
    ImGuiConfigFlags_None                   = 0,
1629
    ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard      = 1 << 0,   // Master keyboard navigation enable flag. Enable full Tabbing + directional arrows + space/enter to activate.
1630
    ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad       = 1 << 1,   // Master gamepad navigation enable flag. Backend also needs to set ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad.
1631
    ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos   = 1 << 2,   // Instruct navigation to move the mouse cursor. May be useful on TV/console systems where moving a virtual mouse is awkward. Will update io.MousePos and set io.WantSetMousePos=true. If enabled you MUST honor io.WantSetMousePos requests in your backend, otherwise ImGui will react as if the mouse is jumping around back and forth.
1632
    ImGuiConfigFlags_NavNoCaptureKeyboard   = 1 << 3,   // Instruct navigation to not set the io.WantCaptureKeyboard flag when io.NavActive is set.
1633
    ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouse                = 1 << 4,   // Instruct imgui to clear mouse position/buttons in NewFrame(). This allows ignoring the mouse information set by the backend.
1634
    ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouseCursorChange    = 1 << 5,   // Instruct backend to not alter mouse cursor shape and visibility. Use if the backend cursor changes are interfering with yours and you don't want to use SetMouseCursor() to change mouse cursor. You may want to honor requests from imgui by reading GetMouseCursor() yourself instead.
1635
1636
    // [BETA] Docking
1637
    ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable          = 1 << 6,   // Docking enable flags.
1638
1639
    // [BETA] Viewports
1640
    // When using viewports it is recommended that your default value for ImGuiCol_WindowBg is opaque (Alpha=1.0) so transition to a viewport won't be noticeable.
1641
    ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable        = 1 << 10,  // Viewport enable flags (require both ImGuiBackendFlags_PlatformHasViewports + ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasViewports set by the respective backends)
1642
    ImGuiConfigFlags_DpiEnableScaleViewports= 1 << 14,  // [BETA: Don't use] FIXME-DPI: Reposition and resize imgui windows when the DpiScale of a viewport changed (mostly useful for the main viewport hosting other window). Note that resizing the main window itself is up to your application.
1643
    ImGuiConfigFlags_DpiEnableScaleFonts    = 1 << 15,  // [BETA: Don't use] FIXME-DPI: Request bitmap-scaled fonts to match DpiScale. This is a very low-quality workaround. The correct way to handle DPI is _currently_ to replace the atlas and/or fonts in the Platform_OnChangedViewport callback, but this is all early work in progress.
1644
1645
    // User storage (to allow your backend/engine to communicate to code that may be shared between multiple projects. Those flags are NOT used by core Dear ImGui)
1646
    ImGuiConfigFlags_IsSRGB                 = 1 << 20,  // Application is SRGB-aware.
1647
    ImGuiConfigFlags_IsTouchScreen          = 1 << 21,  // Application is using a touch screen instead of a mouse.
1648
};
1649
1650
// Backend capabilities flags stored in io.BackendFlags. Set by imgui_impl_xxx or custom backend.
1651
enum ImGuiBackendFlags_
1652
{
1653
    ImGuiBackendFlags_None                  = 0,
1654
    ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad            = 1 << 0,   // Backend Platform supports gamepad and currently has one connected.
1655
    ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors       = 1 << 1,   // Backend Platform supports honoring GetMouseCursor() value to change the OS cursor shape.
1656
    ImGuiBackendFlags_HasSetMousePos        = 1 << 2,   // Backend Platform supports io.WantSetMousePos requests to reposition the OS mouse position (only used if ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos is set).
1657
    ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset  = 1 << 3,   // Backend Renderer supports ImDrawCmd::VtxOffset. This enables output of large meshes (64K+ vertices) while still using 16-bit indices.
1658
1659
    // [BETA] Viewports
1660
    ImGuiBackendFlags_PlatformHasViewports  = 1 << 10,  // Backend Platform supports multiple viewports.
1661
    ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseHoveredViewport=1 << 11,  // Backend Platform supports calling io.AddMouseViewportEvent() with the viewport under the mouse. IF POSSIBLE, ignore viewports with the ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs flag (Win32 backend, GLFW 3.30+ backend can do this, SDL backend cannot). If this cannot be done, Dear ImGui needs to use a flawed heuristic to find the viewport under.
1662
    ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasViewports  = 1 << 12,  // Backend Renderer supports multiple viewports.
1663
};
1664
1665

    ImGuiCol_TitleBg,

    ImGuiCol_TitleBgActive,

    ImGuiCol_ResizeGrip,            // Resize grip in lower-right and lower-left corners of windows.

    ImGuiCol_ResizeGripHovered,

    ImGuiCol_Tab,                   // TabItem in a TabBar

    ImGuiCol_TabUnfocusedActive,

    ImGuiCol_DockingPreview,        // Preview overlay color when about to docking something

    ImGuiCol_DockingEmptyBg,        // Background color for empty node (e.g. CentralNode with no window docked into it)
1708
    ImGuiCol_PlotLines,
1709
    ImGuiCol_PlotLinesHovered,
1710
    ImGuiCol_PlotHistogram,
1711
    ImGuiCol_PlotHistogramHovered,
1712
    ImGuiCol_TableHeaderBg,         // Table header background
1713
    ImGuiCol_TableBorderStrong,     // Table outer and header borders (prefer using Alpha=1.0 here)
1714
    ImGuiCol_TableBorderLight,      // Table inner borders (prefer using Alpha=1.0 here)
1715
    ImGuiCol_TableRowBg,            // Table row background (even rows)
1716
    ImGuiCol_TableRowBgAlt,         // Table row background (odd rows)
1717
    ImGuiCol_TextSelectedBg,
1718
    ImGuiCol_DragDropTarget,        // Rectangle highlighting a drop target
1719
    ImGuiCol_NavHighlight,          // Gamepad/keyboard: current highlighted item
1720
    ImGuiCol_NavWindowingHighlight, // Highlight window when using CTRL+TAB
1721
    ImGuiCol_NavWindowingDimBg,     // Darken/colorize entire screen behind the CTRL+TAB window list, when active
1722
    ImGuiCol_ModalWindowDimBg,      // Darken/colorize entire screen behind a modal window, when one is active
1723
    ImGuiCol_COUNT
1724
};
1725
1726
// Enumeration for PushStyleVar() / PopStyleVar() to temporarily modify the ImGuiStyle structure.
1727
// - The enum only refers to fields of ImGuiStyle which makes sense to be pushed/popped inside UI code.
1728
//   During initialization or between frames, feel free to just poke into ImGuiStyle directly.
1729
// - Tip: Use your programming IDE navigation facilities on the names in the _second column_ below to find the actual members and their description.
1730
//   In Visual Studio IDE: CTRL+comma ("Edit.GoToAll") can follow symbols in comments, whereas CTRL+F12 ("Edit.GoToImplementation") cannot.
1731
//   With Visual Assist installed: ALT+G ("VAssistX.GoToImplementation") can also follow symbols in comments.
1732
// - When changing this enum, you need to update the associated internal table GStyleVarInfo[] accordingly. This is where we link enum values to members offset/type.
1733
enum ImGuiStyleVar_
1734
{
1735
    // Enum name --------------------- // Member in ImGuiStyle structure (see ImGuiStyle for descriptions)
1736
    ImGuiStyleVar_Alpha,               // float     Alpha
1737
    ImGuiStyleVar_DisabledAlpha,       // float     DisabledAlpha
1738
    ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding,       // ImVec2    WindowPadding
1739
    ImGuiStyleVar_WindowRounding,      // float     WindowRounding
1740
    ImGuiStyleVar_WindowBorderSize,    // float     WindowBorderSize
1741
    ImGuiStyleVar_WindowMinSize,       // ImVec2    WindowMinSize
1742
    ImGuiStyleVar_WindowTitleAlign,    // ImVec2    WindowTitleAlign
1743
    ImGuiStyleVar_ChildRounding,       // float     ChildRounding
1744
    ImGuiStyleVar_ChildBorderSize,     // float     ChildBorderSize
1745
    ImGuiStyleVar_PopupRounding,       // float     PopupRounding
1746
    ImGuiStyleVar_PopupBorderSize,     // float     PopupBorderSize
1747
    ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding,        // ImVec2    FramePadding
1748
    ImGuiStyleVar_FrameRounding,       // float     FrameRounding
1749
    ImGuiStyleVar_FrameBorderSize,     // float     FrameBorderSize
1750
    ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing,         // ImVec2    ItemSpacing
1751
    ImGuiStyleVar_ItemInnerSpacing,    // ImVec2    ItemInnerSpacing
1752
    ImGuiStyleVar_IndentSpacing,       // float     IndentSpacing
1753
    ImGuiStyleVar_CellPadding,         // ImVec2    CellPadding
1754
    ImGuiStyleVar_ScrollbarSize,       // float     ScrollbarSize
1755
    ImGuiStyleVar_ScrollbarRounding,   // float     ScrollbarRounding
1756
    ImGuiStyleVar_GrabMinSize,         // float     GrabMinSize
1757
    ImGuiStyleVar_GrabRounding,        // float     GrabRounding
1758
    ImGuiStyleVar_TabRounding,         // float     TabRounding
1759
    ImGuiStyleVar_TabBarBorderSize,    // float     TabBarBorderSize
1760
    ImGuiStyleVar_ButtonTextAlign,     // ImVec2    ButtonTextAlign
1761
    ImGuiStyleVar_SelectableTextAlign, // ImVec2    SelectableTextAlign
1762
    ImGuiStyleVar_SeparatorTextBorderSize,// float  SeparatorTextBorderSize
1763
    ImGuiStyleVar_SeparatorTextAlign,  // ImVec2    SeparatorTextAlign
1764
    ImGuiStyleVar_SeparatorTextPadding,// ImVec2    SeparatorTextPadding
1765
    ImGuiStyleVar_DockingSeparatorSize,// float     DockingSeparatorSize
1766
    ImGuiStyleVar_COUNT
1767
};
1768
1769
// Flags for InvisibleButton() [extended in imgui_internal.h]
1770
enum ImGuiButtonFlags_
1771
{
1772
    ImGuiButtonFlags_None                   = 0,
1773
    ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonLeft        = 1 << 0,   // React on left mouse button (default)
1774
    ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonRight       = 1 << 1,   // React on right mouse button
1775
    ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonMiddle      = 1 << 2,   // React on center mouse button
1776
1777
    // [Internal]
1778
    ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonMask_       = ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonLeft | ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonRight | ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonMiddle,
1779
    ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonDefault_    = ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonLeft,
1780
};
1781
1782
// Flags for ColorEdit3() / ColorEdit4() / ColorPicker3() / ColorPicker4() / ColorButton()
1783
enum ImGuiColorEditFlags_
1784
{
1785
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_None            = 0,
1786
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha         = 1 << 1,   //              // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: ignore Alpha component (will only read 3 components from the input pointer).
1787
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoPicker        = 1 << 2,   //              // ColorEdit: disable picker when clicking on color square.
1788
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions       = 1 << 3,   //              // ColorEdit: disable toggling options menu when right-clicking on inputs/small preview.
1789
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSmallPreview  = 1 << 4,   //              // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: disable color square preview next to the inputs. (e.g. to show only the inputs)
1790
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs        = 1 << 5,   //              // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: disable inputs sliders/text widgets (e.g. to show only the small preview color square).
1791
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip       = 1 << 6,   //              // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: disable tooltip when hovering the preview.
1792
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel         = 1 << 7,   //              // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: disable display of inline text label (the label is still forwarded to the tooltip and picker).
1793
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview   = 1 << 8,   //              // ColorPicker: disable bigger color preview on right side of the picker, use small color square preview instead.
1794
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop      = 1 << 9,   //              // ColorEdit: disable drag and drop target. ColorButton: disable drag and drop source.
1795
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoBorder        = 1 << 10,  //              // ColorButton: disable border (which is enforced by default)
1796
1797
    // User Options (right-click on widget to change some of them).
1798
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar        = 1 << 16,  //              // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: show vertical alpha bar/gradient in picker.
1799
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreview    = 1 << 17,  //              // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: display preview as a transparent color over a checkerboard, instead of opaque.
1800
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf= 1 << 18,  //              // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: display half opaque / half checkerboard, instead of opaque.
1801
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR             = 1 << 19,  //              // (WIP) ColorEdit: Currently only disable 0.0f..1.0f limits in RGBA edition (note: you probably want to use ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float flag as well).
1802
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB      = 1 << 20,  // [Display]    // ColorEdit: override _display_ type among RGB/HSV/Hex. ColorPicker: select any combination using one or more of RGB/HSV/Hex.
1803
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV      = 1 << 21,  // [Display]    // "
1804
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex      = 1 << 22,  // [Display]    // "
1805
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_Uint8           = 1 << 23,  // [DataType]   // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: _display_ values formatted as 0..255.
1806
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float           = 1 << 24,  // [DataType]   // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: _display_ values formatted as 0.0f..1.0f floats instead of 0..255 integers. No round-trip of value via integers.
1807
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar    = 1 << 25,  // [Picker]     // ColorPicker: bar for Hue, rectangle for Sat/Value.
1808
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel  = 1 << 26,  // [Picker]     // ColorPicker: wheel for Hue, triangle for Sat/Value.
1809
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB        = 1 << 27,  // [Input]      // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: input and output data in RGB format.
1810
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV        = 1 << 28,  // [Input]      // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: input and output data in HSV format.
1811
1812
    // Defaults Options. You can set application defaults using SetColorEditOptions(). The intent is that you probably don't want to
1813
    // override them in most of your calls. Let the user choose via the option menu and/or call SetColorEditOptions() once during startup.
1814
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_DefaultOptions_ = ImGuiColorEditFlags_Uint8 | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB | ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB | ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar,
1815
1816
    // [Internal] Masks
1817
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_    = ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex,
1818
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_   = ImGuiColorEditFlags_Uint8 | ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float,
1819
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_     = ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel | ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar,
1820
    ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_      = ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB | ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV,
1821
1822
    // Obsolete names
1823
    //ImGuiColorEditFlags_RGB = ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB, ImGuiColorEditFlags_HSV = ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV, ImGuiColorEditFlags_HEX = ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex  // [renamed in 1.69]
1824
};
1825
1826
// Flags for DragFloat(), DragInt(), SliderFloat(), SliderInt() etc.
1827
// We use the same sets of flags for DragXXX() and SliderXXX() functions as the features are the same and it makes it easier to swap them.
1828
// (Those are per-item flags. There are shared flags in ImGuiIO: io.ConfigDragClickToInputText)
1829
enum ImGuiSliderFlags_
1830
{
1831
    ImGuiSliderFlags_None                   = 0,
1832
    ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp            = 1 << 4,       // Clamp value to min/max bounds when input manually with CTRL+Click. By default CTRL+Click allows going out of bounds.
1833
    ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic            = 1 << 5,       // Make the widget logarithmic (linear otherwise). Consider using ImGuiSliderFlags_NoRoundToFormat with this if using a format-string with small amount of digits.
1834
    ImGuiSliderFlags_NoRoundToFormat        = 1 << 6,       // Disable rounding underlying value to match precision of the display format string (e.g. %.3f values are rounded to those 3 digits)
1835
    ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput                = 1 << 7,       // Disable CTRL+Click or Enter key allowing to input text directly into the widget
1836
    ImGuiSliderFlags_InvalidMask_           = 0x7000000F,   // [Internal] We treat using those bits as being potentially a 'float power' argument from the previous API that has got miscast to this enum, and will trigger an assert if needed.
1837
1838
    // Obsolete names
1839
    //ImGuiSliderFlags_ClampOnInput = ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp, // [renamed in 1.79]
1840
};
1841
1842
// Identify a mouse button.
1843
// Those values are guaranteed to be stable and we frequently use 0/1 directly. Named enums provided for convenience.
1844
enum ImGuiMouseButton_
1845
{
1846
    ImGuiMouseButton_Left = 0,
1847
    ImGuiMouseButton_Right = 1,
1848
    ImGuiMouseButton_Middle = 2,
1849
    ImGuiMouseButton_COUNT = 5
1850
};
1851
1852
// Enumeration for GetMouseCursor()
1853
// User code may request backend to display given cursor by calling SetMouseCursor(), which is why we have some cursors that are marked unused here
1854
enum ImGuiMouseCursor_
1855
{
1856
    ImGuiMouseCursor_None = -1,
1857
    ImGuiMouseCursor_Arrow = 0,
1858
    ImGuiMouseCursor_TextInput,         // When hovering over InputText, etc.
1859
    ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeAll,         // (Unused by Dear ImGui functions)
1860
    ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNS,          // When hovering over a horizontal border
1861
    ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeEW,          // When hovering over a vertical border or a column
1862
    ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNESW,        // When hovering over the bottom-left corner of a window
1863
    ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNWSE,        // When hovering over the bottom-right corner of a window
1864
    ImGuiMouseCursor_Hand,              // (Unused by Dear ImGui functions. Use for e.g. hyperlinks)
1865
    ImGuiMouseCursor_NotAllowed,        // When hovering something with disallowed interaction. Usually a crossed circle.
1866
    ImGuiMouseCursor_COUNT
1867
};
1868
1869
// Enumeration for AddMouseSourceEvent() actual source of Mouse Input data.
1870
// Historically we use "Mouse" terminology everywhere to indicate pointer data, e.g. MousePos, IsMousePressed(), io.AddMousePosEvent()
1871
// But that "Mouse" data can come from different source which occasionally may be useful for application to know about.
1872
// You can submit a change of pointer type using io.AddMouseSourceEvent().
1873
enum ImGuiMouseSource : int
1874
{
1875
    ImGuiMouseSource_Mouse = 0,         // Input is coming from an actual mouse.
1876
    ImGuiMouseSource_TouchScreen,       // Input is coming from a touch screen (no hovering prior to initial press, less precise initial press aiming, dual-axis wheeling possible).
1877
    ImGuiMouseSource_Pen,               // Input is coming from a pressure/magnetic pen (often used in conjunction with high-sampling rates).
1878
    ImGuiMouseSource_COUNT
1879
};
1880
1881
// Enumeration for ImGui::SetWindow***(), SetNextWindow***(), SetNextItem***() functions
1882
// Represent a condition.
1883
// Important: Treat as a regular enum! Do NOT combine multiple values using binary operators! All the functions above treat 0 as a shortcut to ImGuiCond_Always.
1884
enum ImGuiCond_
1885
{
1886
    ImGuiCond_None          = 0,        // No condition (always set the variable), same as _Always
1887
    ImGuiCond_Always        = 1 << 0,   // No condition (always set the variable), same as _None
1888
    ImGuiCond_Once          = 1 << 1,   // Set the variable once per runtime session (only the first call will succeed)
1889
    ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver  = 1 << 2,   // Set the variable if the object/window has no persistently saved data (no entry in .ini file)
1890
    ImGuiCond_Appearing     = 1 << 3,   // Set the variable if the object/window is appearing after being hidden/inactive (or the first time)
1891
};
1892
1893
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1894
// [SECTION] Helpers: Memory allocations macros, ImVector<>
1895
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1896
1897
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1898
// IM_MALLOC(), IM_FREE(), IM_NEW(), IM_PLACEMENT_NEW(), IM_DELETE()
1899
// We call C++ constructor on own allocated memory via the placement "new(ptr) Type()" syntax.
1900
// Defining a custom placement new() with a custom parameter allows us to bypass including <new> which on some platforms complains when user has disabled exceptions.
1901
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1902
1903
struct ImNewWrapper {};
1904
10
inline void* operator new(size_t, ImNewWrapper, void* ptr) { return ptr; }
1905
0
inline void  operator delete(void*, ImNewWrapper, void*)   {} // This is only required so we can use the symmetrical new()
1906
1.21k
#define IM_ALLOC(_SIZE)                     ImGui::MemAlloc(_SIZE)
1907
1.17k
#define IM_FREE(_PTR)                       ImGui::MemFree(_PTR)
1908
6
#define IM_PLACEMENT_NEW(_PTR)              new(ImNewWrapper(), _PTR)
1909
13
#define IM_NEW(_TYPE)                       new(ImNewWrapper(), ImGui::MemAlloc(sizeof(_TYPE))) _TYPE
1910
0
template<typename T> void IM_DELETE(T* p)   { if (p) { p->~T(); ImGui::MemFree(p); } }
Unexecuted instantiation: void IM_DELETE<ImGuiViewportP>(ImGuiViewportP*)
Unexecuted instantiation: void IM_DELETE<ImDrawList>(ImDrawList*)
Unexecuted instantiation: void IM_DELETE<ImGuiContext>(ImGuiContext*)
Unexecuted instantiation: void IM_DELETE<ImFontAtlas>(ImFontAtlas*)
Unexecuted instantiation: void IM_DELETE<ImGuiWindow>(ImGuiWindow*)
Unexecuted instantiation: void IM_DELETE<char>(char*)
Unexecuted instantiation: void IM_DELETE<ImGuiDockNode>(ImGuiDockNode*)
Unexecuted instantiation: void IM_DELETE<ImGuiTabBar>(ImGuiTabBar*)
Unexecuted instantiation: void IM_DELETE<ImFont>(ImFont*)
Unexecuted instantiation: void IM_DELETE<ImGui_ImplGlfw_ViewportData>(ImGui_ImplGlfw_ViewportData*)
Unexecuted instantiation: void IM_DELETE<ImGui_ImplGlfw_Data>(ImGui_ImplGlfw_Data*)
Unexecuted instantiation: void IM_DELETE<ImGui_ImplOpenGL3_Data>(ImGui_ImplOpenGL3_Data*)
1911
1912
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1913
// ImVector<>
1914
// Lightweight std::vector<>-like class to avoid dragging dependencies (also, some implementations of STL with debug enabled are absurdly slow, we bypass it so our code runs fast in debug).
1915
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1916
// - You generally do NOT need to care or use this ever. But we need to make it available in imgui.h because some of our public structures are relying on it.
1917
// - We use std-like naming convention here, which is a little unusual for this codebase.
1918
// - Important: clear() frees memory, resize(0) keep the allocated buffer. We use resize(0) a lot to intentionally recycle allocated buffers across frames and amortize our costs.
1919
// - Important: our implementation does NOT call C++ constructors/destructors, we treat everything as raw data! This is intentional but be extra mindful of that,
1920
//   Do NOT use this class as a std::vector replacement in your own code! Many of the structures used by dear imgui can be safely initialized by a zero-memset.
1921
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1922
1923
IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_OFF
1924
template<typename T>
1925
struct ImVector
1926
{
1927
    int                 Size;
1928
    int                 Capacity;
1929
    T*                  Data;
1930
1931
    // Provide standard typedefs but we don't use them ourselves.
1932
    typedef T                   value_type;
1933
    typedef value_type*         iterator;
1934
    typedef const value_type*   const_iterator;
1935
1936
    // Constructors, destructor
1937
108
    inline ImVector()                                       { Size = Capacity = 0; Data = NULL; }
Unexecuted instantiation: ImVector<ImGuiListClipperRange>::ImVector()
ImVector<ImGuiPlatformMonitor>::ImVector()

    inline void         swap(ImVector<T>& rhs)              { int rhs_size = rhs.Size; rhs.Size = Size; Size = rhs_size; int rhs_cap = rhs.Capacity; rhs.Capacity = Capacity; Capacity = rhs_cap; T* rhs_data = rhs.Data; rhs.Data = Data; Data = rhs_data; }

3.58k
    inline void         resize(int new_size, const T& v)    { if (new_size > Capacity) reserve(_grow_capacity(new_size)); if (new_size > Size) for (int n = Size; n < new_size; n++) memcpy(&Data[n], &v, sizeof(v)); Size = new_size; }

    inline void         shrink(int new_size)                { IM_ASSERT(new_size <= Size); Size = new_size; } // Resize a vector to a smaller size, guaranteed not to cause a reallocation

1968
37.3k
    inline void         reserve(int new_capacity)           { if (new_capacity <= Capacity) return; T* new_data = (T*)IM_ALLOC((size_t)new_capacity * sizeof(T)); if (Data) { memcpy(new_data, Data, (size_t)Size * sizeof(T)); IM_FREE(Data); } Data = new_data; Capacity = new_capacity; }

    inline void         reserve(int new_capacity)           { if (new_capacity <= Capacity) return; T* new_data = (T*)IM_ALLOC((size_t)new_capacity * sizeof(T)); if (Data) { memcpy(new_data, Data, (size_t)Size * sizeof(T)); IM_FREE(Data); } Data = new_data; Capacity = new_capacity; }
ImVector<ImVec4>::reserve(int)

    // NB: It is illegal to call push_back/push_front/insert with a reference pointing inside the ImVector data itself! e.g. v.push_back(v[10]) is forbidden.

    inline void         push_back(const T& v)               { if (Size == Capacity) reserve(_grow_capacity(Size + 1)); memcpy(&Data[Size], &v, sizeof(v)); Size++; }

    inline void         push_front(const T& v)              { if (Size == 0) push_back(v); else insert(Data, v); }

0
    inline T*           erase(const T* it)                  { IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it < Data + Size); const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data; memmove(Data + off, Data + off + 1, ((size_t)Size - (size_t)off - 1) * sizeof(T)); Size--; return Data + off; }
Unexecuted instantiation: ImVector<ImGuiListClipperRange>::erase(ImGuiListClipperRange const*)
Unexecuted instantiation: ImVector<ImGuiWindow*>::erase(ImGuiWindow* const*)
Unexecuted instantiation: ImVector<ImGuiViewportP*>::erase(ImGuiViewportP* const*)
Unexecuted instantiation: ImVector<ImGuiContextHook>::erase(ImGuiContextHook const*)
Unexecuted instantiation: ImVector<ImGuiSettingsHandler>::erase(ImGuiSettingsHandler const*)
Unexecuted instantiation: ImVector<ImDrawCmd>::erase(ImDrawCmd const*)
Unexecuted instantiation: ImVector<ImGuiTabItem>::erase(ImGuiTabItem const*)
1976
2.37k
    inline T*           erase(const T* it, const T* it_last){ IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it < Data + Size && it_last >= it && it_last <= Data + Size); const ptrdiff_t count = it_last - it; const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data; memmove(Data + off, Data + off + count, ((size_t)Size - (size_t)off - (size_t)count) * sizeof(T)); Size -= (int)count; return Data + off; }
1977
    inline T*           erase_unsorted(const T* it)         { IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it < Data + Size);  const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data; if (it < Data + Size - 1) memcpy(Data + off, Data + Size - 1, sizeof(T)); Size--; return Data + off; }
1978
3
    inline T*           insert(const T* it, const T& v)     { IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it <= Data + Size); const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data; if (Size == Capacity) reserve(_grow_capacity(Size + 1)); if (off < (int)Size) memmove(Data + off + 1, Data + off, ((size_t)Size - (size_t)off) * sizeof(T)); memcpy(&Data[off], &v, sizeof(v)); Size++; return Data + off; }
Unexecuted instantiation: ImVector<ImGuiListClipperRange>::insert(ImGuiListClipperRange const*, ImGuiListClipperRange const&)
Unexecuted instantiation: ImVector<ImDrawCmd>::insert(ImDrawCmd const*, ImDrawCmd const&)
Unexecuted instantiation: ImVector<ImGuiWindow*>::insert(ImGuiWindow* const*, ImGuiWindow* const&)
ImVector<ImGuiStorage::ImGuiStoragePair>::insert(ImGuiStorage::ImGuiStoragePair const*, ImGuiStorage::ImGuiStoragePair const&)
Line
Count
Source
1978
3
    inline T*           insert(const T* it, const T& v)     { IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it <= Data + Size); const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data; if (Size == Capacity) reserve(_grow_capacity(Size + 1)); if (off < (int)Size) memmove(Data + off + 1, Data + off, ((size_t)Size - (size_t)off) * sizeof(T)); memcpy(&Data[off], &v, sizeof(v)); Size++; return Data + off; }
1979
3
    inline bool         contains(const T& v) const          { const T* data = Data;  const T* data_end = Data + Size; while (data < data_end) if (*data++ == v) return true; return false; }
ImVector<ImGuiWindow*>::contains(ImGuiWindow* const&) const
Line
Count
Source
1979
3
    inline bool         contains(const T& v) const          { const T* data = Data;  const T* data_end = Data + Size; while (data < data_end) if (*data++ == v) return true; return false; }
Unexecuted instantiation: ImVector<ImGuiViewport*>::contains(ImGuiViewport* const&) const
Unexecuted instantiation: ImVector<unsigned int>::contains(unsigned int const&) const
1980
0
    inline T*           find(const T& v)                    { T* data = Data;  const T* data_end = Data + Size; while (data < data_end) if (*data == v) break; else ++data; return data; }
1981
    inline const T*     find(const T& v) const              { const T* data = Data;  const T* data_end = Data + Size; while (data < data_end) if (*data == v) break; else ++data; return data; }
1982
    inline int          find_index(const T& v) const        { const T* data_end = Data + Size; const T* it = find(v); if (it == data_end) return -1; const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data; return (int)off; }
1983
0
    inline bool         find_erase(const T& v)              { const T* it = find(v); if (it < Data + Size) { erase(it); return true; } return false; }
1984
    inline bool         find_erase_unsorted(const T& v)     { const T* it = find(v); if (it < Data + Size) { erase_unsorted(it); return true; } return false; }
1985
0
    inline int          index_from_ptr(const T* it) const   { IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it < Data + Size); const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data; return (int)off; }
Unexecuted instantiation: ImVector<ImGuiTabItem>::index_from_ptr(ImGuiTabItem const*) const
Unexecuted instantiation: ImVector<ImGuiWindow*>::index_from_ptr(ImGuiWindow* const*) const
